name: Jollof Rice
instruction: Wash rice in cold water and drain.
Blend tomato paste, onion, red bell pepper, and scotch bonnet pepper to a smooth consistency.
Heat up vegetable oil in a large pot and add the blended mixture.
Add minced garlic, thyme, bay leaves, curry powder, smoked paprika, and salt to taste.
Cook on medium heat until the mixture thickens and the oil rises to the top.
Add the washed rice and water and stir well.
Reduce heat to low and let the rice cook for 20-25 minutes or until the rice is cooked through and the water is absorbed.

name: Classic Margherita Pizza
instruction: Preheat the oven to 450°F.
Roll out the pizza dough into a 12-inch circle.
Spread the tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a 1-inch border around the edges.
Top the pizza with the mozzarella cheese.
Bake the pizza for 10-12 minutes, until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove the pizza from the oven and top with fresh basil leaves and a drizzle of olive oil.
Slice and serve hot.

name: Chicken Parmesan
instruction: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Coat the chicken breasts in flour, shaking off any excess.
Dip the chicken breasts in the beaten eggs, then coat them in the breadcrumbs.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken breasts to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
Transfer the chicken breasts to a baking dish.
Top each chicken breast with tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, and Parmesan cheese.
Bake the chicken for 20-25 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the chicken is cooked through.
Remove from the oven and let the chicken rest for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Banana Bread
instruction: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Combine the mashed bananas and melted butter in a large mixing bowl.
Add the baking soda, salt, and sugar, and mix well.
Stir in the beaten egg and vanilla extract.
Add the flour and mix until just combined.
Pour the batter into a greased loaf pan.
Bake the banana bread for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the bread comes out clean.
Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
Remove the bread from the pan and transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instruction: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, beat the butter, white sugar, and brown sugar together until creamy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the mixing bowl, stirring until just combined.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until lightly golden brown.
Let cool for 5 minutes on the baking sheets before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.
